attributes.name: project_name
attributes.value: Bacteria have recently emerged as important constituents of the lichen holobiont, which is defined as a symbiotic association of a mycobiont (fungus) and a photobiont (green alga and/or cyanobacterium). Lichens are classical models for symbiosis, now they are used to get mechanistic insights into native microbiome functioning. A high proportion of the present bacteria remains uncultivable with current approaches, thus their ecological function in globally widespread lichenized fungi is still mostly unknown. In the present study, 29 bacterial metagenome-assembled genome (MAG) sequences were constructed from three different lichenized fungi metagenomes and taxonomically classified to three phyla. This resource provides a new basis to further shed light on the ecological functions of bacterial symbionts in lichenized fungi.

description.comment: This sample represents an uncultured Sphingomonas sp. MAG assembled and binned from ERR7747324.

attributes.name: MAG coverage software
attributes.value: Reads (ERR7747324) were merged using BBMerge (rem k=62 extend2=50 ecct vstrict) and then mapped to assembled contigs >=1500bp (ERZ4560480) using Bowtie2 v2.3.4 (--very-sensitive -X 1000). Coverage was calculated using jgi_summarize_bam_contig_depths (default parameters) from MetaBAT2 v2.15.

attributes.name: assembly quality
attributes.value: Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics.

attributes.name: binning parameters
attributes.value: Reads from ERR7747324 were assembled into contigs (ERZ4560480). The following read sets from this study were the most similar to ERR7747324 as determined by MASH (-r -m 2 -s 100000 -k 32): ERR7747324,ERR7745859,ERR7745335,ERR7745994,ERR7745823,ERR7745906,ERR7738581,ERR7746051,ERR7746688,ERR7747394. Following processing using BBMerge (rem k=62 extend2=50 ecct vstrict), reads from each of these 10 samples were mapped using bowtie2 v2.3.4 (--very-sensitive -X 1000) onto contigs >=1500bp from ERZ4560480. Depth information for all 10 mapped samples was utilized by MetaBAT2 2.15 for genome binning. Contigs flagged by any module in MAGpurify 2.1.0 (--weighted mode for gc_content, tetra_freq, and coverage modules; conspecific database augmented by high-quality MAGs from this study) were removed from the bin.

attributes.name: contamination screening parameters
attributes.value: All reads in ERR7747324 failed to map to hg19 (with custom masking) using BBMap v38.86 (minid=0.95 maxindel=3 bwr=0.16 bw=12 minhits=2).

attributes.name: project_name
attributes.value: Bacteria have recently emerged as important constituents of the lichen holobiont, which is defined as a symbiotic association of a mycobiont (fungus) and a photobiont (green alga and/or cyanobacterium). Lichens are classical models for symbiosis, now they are used to get mechanistic insights into native microbiome functioning. A high proportion of the present bacteria remains uncultivable with current approaches, thus their ecological function in globally widespread lichenized fungi is still mostly unknown. In the present study, 29 bacterial metagenome-assembled genome (MAG) sequences were constructed from three different lichenized fungi metagenomes and taxonomically classified to three phyla. This resource provides a new basis to further shed light on the ecological functions of bacterial symbionts in lichenized fungi.

attributes.name: project_name
attributes.value: Lichen metagenomes produced de novo for Tagridzhanova et al. 2023. Evidence for a core set of microbial lichen symbionts from a global survey of metagenomes. biorXiv. Lichens are the archetypal symbiosis and the one for which the term was coined. Although application of shotgun sequencing techniques has shown that many lichen symbioses can harbour more symbionts than the canonically recognized fungus and photobiont, no global census of lichen organismal composition has been undertaken. Here, we analyze the genome content of 437 lichen metagenomes from six continents, and show that four bacterial lineages occur in the majority of lichen symbioses, at a frequency on par with algal photobionts. A single bacterial genus, Lichenihabitans, occurs in nearly one-third of all lichens sampled. Genome annotations from the most common lichen bacterial symbionts suggest they are aerobic anoxygenic photoheterotrophs and produce essential vitamins, but do not fix nitrogen. We also detected secondary basidiomycete symbionts in about two-thirds of analyzed metagenomes. Our survey suggests a core set of four to seven microbial symbionts are involved in forming and maintaining lichen symbioses.

biosample.project_name: Lichen metagenomes produced de novo for Tagridzhanova et al. 2023. Evidence for a core set of microbial lichen symbionts from a global survey of metagenomes. biorXiv. Lichens are the archetypal symbiosis and the one for which the term was coined. Although application of shotgun sequencing techniques has shown that many lichen symbioses can harbour more symbionts than the canonically recognized fungus and photobiont, no global census of lichen organismal composition has been undertaken. Here, we analyze the genome content of 437 lichen metagenomes from six continents, and show that four bacterial lineages occur in the majority of lichen symbioses, at a frequency on par with algal photobionts. A single bacterial genus, Lichenihabitans, occurs in nearly one-third of all lichens sampled. Genome annotations from the most common lichen bacterial symbionts suggest they are aerobic anoxygenic photoheterotrophs and produce essential vitamins, but do not fix nitrogen. We also detected secondary basidiomycete symbionts in about two-thirds of analyzed metagenomes. Our survey suggests a core set of four to seven microbial symbionts are involved in forming and maintaining lichen symbioses.

attributes.name: project_name
attributes.value: A lichen is a symbiotic association of a fungus and a photosynthesizing partner, such as a green algae or cyanobacterium. The symbiosis is usually obligate for the fungus. The goal of this study was to generate genome information for phylogenetic analysis from the cultured mycobionts (lichenizing fungi) and lichen thalli spanning the diversity of lichenized groups in the classes Lecanoromycetes, Eurotiomycetes, Dothidiomycetes, Arthoniomycetes and Lichinomycetes. Leptogium austroamericanum is a lichen composed of the lichenizing fungus Leptogium austroamericanum (for which the association is named) and its cyanobacterial photobiont. The metagenome data here include sequences from the lichenizing fungus Leptogium austroamericanum (class Lecanoromycetes, subclass Lecanoromycetidae), the cyanobacterial photobiont, and possibly endolichenic fungi or prokaryotes.

Leptogium austroamericanum is a lichen composed of the lichenizing fungus Leptogium austroamericanum (for which the association is named) and its cyanobacterial photobiont. attributes.name: project_name
attributes.value: Bacteria have recently emerged as important constituents of the lichen holobiont, which is defined as a symbiotic association of a mycobiont (fungus) and a photobiont (green alga and/or cyanobacterium). Lichens are classical models for symbiosis, now they are used to get mechanistic insights into native microbiome functioning. A high proportion of the present bacteria remains uncultivable with current approaches, thus their ecological function in globally widespread lichenized fungi is still mostly unknown. In the present study, 29 bacterial metagenome-assembled genome (MAG) sequences were constructed from three different lichenized fungi metagenomes and taxonomically classified to three phyla. This resource provides a new basis to further shed light on the ecological functions of bacterial symbionts in lichenized fungi.
